data.title: Great Food. . .Great Prices
data.text: I eat at Mexi-deli perhaps 3 times per month. . .it is a great place to take my son and his family. .. we all love the food and it doesn't break the bank to eat here.  The wait staff is very personable.  I Love the Hot Chili!

data.title: 3 1/2 stars really
data.text: I like their food, especially their specialty, which consists of a fried flat tortilla with various toppings, smothered in green chili.  It's quite good, but it's much too expensive for a take-out place.

data.title: Excellent trademark dish
data.text: Have went by this for years and decided to try it.  Was not disappointed.  They have a trademark taco with choice of hot sauces that is out of this world along with 2 for one beers!  Would highly recommend.

data.title: Best on a Sunday
data.text: Another hard-working Pueblo establishment insisting on doing business by being closed on Sundays. The food is all right and the staff is nice enough, but come on, people! Are you a working restaurant or not?

data.title: Love the Special!
data.text: I went here for a late lunch today and had their Special which is a flat fried flour tortilla with your choice 1-3 fillings topped with house made green Chile lettuce tomato cheese with optional sour cream and guacamole. I had the bean and chicharon and it was delicious, full of crispy pieces of pork skin in refried beans. There are several fillings to choose from. Service was was great and friendly. Good food for a great price. I'll definitely be back!

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Good serving of food for your money and friendly service. Great margaritas. Authentic taste. Convenient location.

data.title: Good Pueblo Mexican food at a very fair price
data.text: Mostly the food is pretty darn good - the chili (green and red) is some of the best Pueblo has to offer, as it is actually hot (if you choose) and flavorful.  The prices are very reasonable, the service is friendly (but not at the drive through window - rude guys who don't seem to want to work there and ALWAYS leave the guacamole off the order!).  The atmosphere is mixed - nice decorations and Mexican folk art, but this is an old Red Barn Restaurant, so there are elements of the 1970's fast food hamburger chain.   Decent music in the background (top 80's, 90's and newer stuff), and margaritas that aren't bad.  Pueblo has such a small number of good restaurants that I might rate this a 3 star anywhere else, but for our town, this gets a four.

data.title: Very bad
data.text: Ive been coming to this place for years and been excellent food and service but this last visit was horrible very dirty flies everywhere service was worst ive ever had workers were dirty looking and disrespectful not a very good place to eat ever again so sad good place at one time not so much no more hopefully. The owner starts to clean up the place starting with the workers....

data.title: Mexican Breakfast
data.text: If you want to start an lively discussion ask which restaurant has the best Breakfast Burritos. Mexi-Deli is my favorite. Each burrito is a good meal. Pick your choice of meat, and choose from mild to tear-making hot!

data.title: bad service
data.text: the service here sucks the food was terrible the wait staff did not ask if we needed anything she didn't ask if we needed another drink overall I will not eat there again and I will not tell anybody about that place because it is god awful nasty it tastes like * thanks have a good day hope no one eats there the food sucks and my husband said the green chili was made from a can it was water  and not gteen it was brown.I will tell you something the place was not clean

data.title: Excellent!!
data.text: We were there for a class reunion and we were served buffet-style.  All of the food was great and the margaritas were super too - had a great time.  Will return when we visit Pueblo again!

data.title: don't use the drive thru
data.text: the last two times wer used the drive thru things were all screwed up got home the first time with two aztecas the only thing on them were beans and meat, they forgot the lettuce, cheese and chilli. went again last night. got a 6 in and 8 in, azteca, this time no chili on either of them and no sour cream on the one. I will never use the drive thru again for dinner for the wife and I if we are doing take out, The guy at the drive thru was the same both times, must be a total idiot.

data.title: Good food
data.text: I always get the beef Aztecs here. It never let's me down. The prices are very affordable, especially for the amount of food you receive. Occasionally the cooks (open kitchen) can be heard using offensive language, which is not professional for the customers. But I will keep retuning to this place simply because the food is very good.

data.title: The other best Mexican food place!
data.text: YUM YUM. Food is indescribably good Mexican food produced in a family setting. Everything on the menu is great. My favorite is the 1A combination, but you really can't go wrong here either. Grew up in Pueblo, and eat here every time I see family. We love them and their food!

data.title: A gem!
data.text: The food is great! Try the Aztec tacos. Best Menudo hands down and the drink prices are excellent. Bartenders know what they are doing.

data.title: Great food, excellent value, drive thru is convenient.
data.text: Great food, good service - excellent prices.  I like to get the a la carte burrito for only $3.50.  What a deal.  Smothered in green chile - delicious.  Sometimes the chile is overly spicy.  The medium is on the edge for me.  Love the drive thru for convenient take out.

data.title: Family run
data.text: Centrally located, quick service, good food, reasonable price. A family run operation with generations old and excellent recipes. They take pride in what they do!

data.title: great restaurant
data.text: I love the food here, exceptional taste. I have had a variety of the dishes and each is very good. I love their machaca burritos.

data.title: Great experience, fantastic food.
data.text:
Don't let the name fool you, Mexi-deli is a fantastic little local restaurant that serves wonderful food.  The taco azteca is very good and I still crave them months after my visit there.  
The only negative was the small waitstaff that left us waiting a bit longer while busy, but that was more than made up for by their polite customer service.  
All in all, a great local place to eat!!!

data.title: Mexi-Critters
data.text: Just wanted to let others know that I will never go to Mexi Deli AKA Mexi Critters again.! I was very appalled to see 2 cockroaches roaming the floor at this little restaurant. Didn't even finish our food and complained to the 'owner' who was very rude and even critized my family!! UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
